content: This article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Tanah Merah Constituency" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(December 2025)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Tanah Merah Constituency** was a constituency in Singapore. It was created in 1980 by merging parts of [Bedok](/wiki/Bedok_Constituency) and [Changi constituencies](/wiki/Changi_Constituency). In 1988, it was abolished and merged into [Bedok Group Representation Constituency](/wiki/Bedok_Group_Representation_Constituency) (GRC). ## History Prior to the [1988 general election](/wiki/1988_Singaporean_general_election), the constituency was merged alongside [Bedok](/wiki/Bedok_Constituency) and [Kampong Chai Chee](/wiki/Kampong_Chai_Chee_Constituency) Constituencies into Bedok GRC. ## Member of Parliament YearMemberParty**Formation****1980**Ibrahim Othman[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)**1984****Constituency abolished (1984)** ## Electoral results Note: The [Elections Department](/wiki/Elections_Department_Singapore) does not include rejected votes when calculating the vote shares of candidates. Hence, all candidates' vote shares will total to 100% at any given election (may not appear so in multi-way contests due to rounding). ### Elections in 1980s This [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) location article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Tanah Merah Constituency
